text: This is a list of the largest cities in each United States state and territory based upon the 2021 population estimates made by the U.S. Census Bureau. State or territory capitals are listed in italics. ==List== State, Federal District, or Territory State, Federal District, or Territory Population Most populous City population 2nd most populous 3rd Charleston 48,018 Huntington Parkersburg Morgantown Wheeling 5,895,908 Milwaukee 569,330 Madison Green Bay Kenosha Racine 578,803 Cheyenne 65,051 Casper Gillette Laramie Rock Springs Note 1: The only incorporated place in Hawaii is the City & County of Honolulu. Some of it, the Honolulu District, is sometimes called the "city of Honolulu" for counting reasons, although it has no government separate from that of the "City and County" as a whole. The U.S. Census Bureau defines the Honolulu Urban CDP (Census Designated Place) as the Honolulu District. For Hawaii, the largest CDPs are listed. Note 2: The most populous villages or settlements of the Northern Mariana Islands are listed. All are on the island of Saipan. Note 3: The most populous sub-districts (as defined by the U.S. Census Bureau) of the U.S. Virgin Islands are listed. The island the sub-district occupies is listed shown, too. ==References== Largest cities, List of U.S. states Largest
title: List of U.S. states' largest cities
